rukus.text: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven to construct
HE raised its structure and then balanced it aright
And made its night dark and its day bright
And the earth thereafter â€” He spread it out
He brought out from it its water and its pasture
And He made the mountains firm
[He has provided] means of sustenance for you and your animals
So when the great event occurs
That Day man would recount what he strove for
And the Hell would be made manifest for all to see
And then anyone who had transgressed divinely set bounds
And had preferred the life of this world
That one's abode shall indeed be in Hell
And one who had been afraid of standing before his Lord and had restrained one's self from carnal desires
That one's abode shall indeed be in Paradise
They ask you [Prophet] about the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin), "When is it coming
What have you to do with the mentioning of it [the time of the occurrence of the Hour]
With your Lord rests the final and only Authority to know when the Hour would happen
You [Prophet] are but a warner for those who fear it [the Hour]
The Day they see it [the Hereafter], they will feel as if they had stayed for only one evening or one morning thereof
